page.title: 13ST.WINWALOE'S CHURCH
page.content: St.Winwaloe's Church at Church Cove, Gunwalloe is a very small church which can accommodate only about 50 people for a service. It was built in the 12th century and has a separate bell tower 3 metres away from the church, and is unusual in having 3 altars. In the 12th century it was quite a long way from the sea, but coastal erosion now threatens it with destruction. The sea wall which was built to protect it needs constant and sometimes costly maintenance. The roof needs repair. Fortunately this cove is very popular with tourists who find the church interesting and are willing to make donations towards its maintenance. It is luckier than some which fall apart in out of the way places, forgotten by everyone.
